She was still wearing a face veil.
She bowed twice barefoot.
She said:
Thank you, master, for coming.

original: 今家人總出恐齋粥失時。
analyzed: 今家人總出恐齋粥失時。
translated: Now the whole family has gone out, fearing that the meals will be missed.
Your disciple has therefore gotten up to prepare them for you.
The master knew it was the deceased person.
He then accepted the offering and was about to chant.
Before he finished chanting, he heard the sound of opening the northern door of the hall.
The woman hurriedly said:
My son has come!
She then rushed into the hall and was heard crying.
After the mourning, the family members visited the master to ask about his well-being.
They saw the porridge in the tray.
They asked the master, saying:
We, the disciples, really avoided disaster last night.
We did not let the master know that there was no one in the family.
Who made this porridge?
The master smiled and did not answer.
The blue-robed woman in the hall was startled, saying:
Why was the deceased lying down last night?
Her hands were stained with flour and her feet were also covered in mud.
What does this mean?
The master then pointed to the porridge that was made and showed it to her.
The whole family was astonished.
Huixin, Huixin, monk Huixin.
Skilled in the Three Treatises and the Lotus Sutra, Diamond Sutra.
Always lectured on them.

original: 至德中黃昏時見一人入門云。
analyzed: 至德中黃昏時見一人入門云。
translated: During the Zhide era, at dusk, he saw a person enter the gate, saying:
The king invites the Dharma master.
Huixin then collapsed.
Only the top of his head was warm for seven days, then he revived.
He said: At first, I followed the messenger to a city.
It was extremely grand and magnificent.
Entering, I saw the king and several hundred people.
Descending from the hall to the gate of the pavilion.
He bowed and said:

original: 弟子不幸主世名祿兼治罪。
analyzed: 弟子不幸主世名祿兼治罪。
translated: Your disciple unfortunately rules the world and concurrently administers punishments.
I find it very painful.
I heard that the Venerable One is good at expounding the Diamond Sutra.
Please explain it for me.
Then he sat down and the lecture was finished.
The king offered 300 bolts of silk.
He was then sent back.
Next, he saw a lecture hall.
There were over 100 monks.
They were discussing together.
At first, they were very polite, but after a while, they competed with each other.
On their fingers, iron claws grew.
They grabbed and scratched each other, smearing blood and flesh on the ground.
The giant jailer of the ox-headed guards burned them with fire.
They all turned into ashes.
In an instant, they returned to their original bodies.
Because of the fright, he woke up and suddenly stood up.
The silk was already in the cabinet, the same as the previous amount.
He was able to use this offering to create merit.
From then on, he no longer lectured.
He only upheld the sutra.
Pufan Pufan monk Pufan.
Do as you wish, not constrained by the appearance of a monk.
Sometimes singing, sometimes laughing, the meaning was beyond comprehension.
When he spoke of events, they often turned out to be true.
Therefore, people of the time treated him as a myriarchy.

original: 後於潞州佛舍中題詩數篇而亡。
analyzed: 後於潞州佛舍中題詩數篇而亡。
translated: Later, in a Buddha hall in Luzhou, he wrote several poems and passed away.
What he had recorded said:
This water connects with the Jing River.
Two pearls are filled with blood in the river.
A blue ox will lead a red tiger.

original: 還號太平年題詩後人莫能知。
analyzed: 還號太平年題詩後人莫能知。
translated: It will still be called the year of great peace. After the poems were written, no one could understand them.
Later, when the rebel Ce raised troops,
the crowd only then understood.
This water refers to the character ce.
Jing River refers to the chaos in Jingzhou.
Two pearls refers to Ce and Tao.

original: 青牛者興元二年乙丑歲。
analyzed: 青牛者興元二年乙丑歲。
translated: Blue ox refers to the second year of the Xingyuan era, the year of the earth ox.
Earth refers to wood.
Ox refers to the ox.
The following year, the era was changed to the Zhenyuan era.
Fire refers to fire.
Tiger refers to the tiger.
By this time, the rebels had already been pacified.
Therefore, it says a blue ox will lead a red tiger.
It will still be called the year of great peace.
Biographies of Eminent Monks, Scroll 7
